header-description: Did you know that it is possible to diagnose Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) at 18 months of age? However, the average age at which a child receives the diagnosis is over 4 years, and it is even later for Black children, those from low-income families, and those living in rural areas.
about-description: Our goal is to contribute to SDG 3 – 'Good Health and Well-being.' With the rising rates of autism spectrum disorders, we decided to focus our studies on developing an innovative solution for this challenge during the Multiplatform Software Development course.
identification-description: It all starts with parents or guardians identifying the signs of ASD in the child. Then, they seek out a healthcare specialist.
importance-description: A qualified healthcare professional will use SOFIA to assist in the pre-diagnosis, ensuring greater effectiveness and accessibility.
innovation-description: Our app uses AI to analyze the completion of screening protocols and the child's demographic data to provide the result.
research-item1: More than 60% of children are diagnosed after the age of 4.
research-item2: 37% of these children see more than 5 doctors before getting a final diagnosis.
research-item3: The main signs of ASD are stereotypies and communication disorders.
research-item4: None of the doctors interviewed used any software to aid in the diagnosis.
research-item5: However, all healthcare specialists were familiar with some virtual tools.
research-item6: 100% of the respondents used their personal phones to assist during consultations.
vale-description: The Vale do Ribeira, located in the interior of SP/Brazil and composed of 22 municipalities, is a predominantly rural region. Applying the equivalence that 2.8% of the population is autistic (CDC), it is possible to calculate that there are more than 300 children between the ages of 0 and 9 with the disorder in the region. Our goal is to make the pre-diagnosis of ASD more accessible for children in rural areas and with low socioeconomic status, such as in the Vale do Ribeira.
future-title: WANT TO HELP SOFIA IN THIS MISSION?
future-description: Although we are an academic project aimed at studying and developing a solution, we are very proud of our results! Our next steps consist of improving the SOFIA AI with a computer vision model to analyze stereotypies and adding new screening protocols to cover other age groups, continuing our focus on the pre-diagnosis of childhood ASD.
